item.title: Observability
item.description:
Starting with CSM 1.12, all deployments will need to use images from quay.io. Please note that from CSM 1.14 (May 2025), upgrading with helm will fail if it attempts to use images from Docker Hub.

This section outlines the upgrade steps for Container Storage Modules (CSM) for Observability. CSM for Observability upgrade can be achieved in one of two ways:

item.title: Resiliency
item.description:
Starting with CSM 1.12, all deployments will need to use images from quay.io. Please note that from CSM 1.14 (May 2025), upgrading with helm will fail if it attempts to use images from Docker Hub.

CSM for Resiliency can be upgraded as part of the Dell CSI driver upgrade process. The drivers can be upgraded either by a helm chart or by the Dell CSM Operator. Currently, only Helm chart upgrade is supported for CSM for Resiliency.

item.title: Replication
item.description:
Starting with CSM 1.12, all deployments will need to use images from quay.io. Please note that from CSM 1.14 (May 2025), upgrading with helm will fail if it attempts to use images from Docker Hub.

CSM Replication module consists of two components:

  • CSM Replication sidecar (installed along with the driver)
  • CSM Replication controller

Those two components should be upgraded separately. When upgrading them ensure that you use the same versions for both sidecar and controller, because different versions could be incompatible with each other.
